commits.message:
Merge pull request #1824 from yachub/add-amazon

Allow amazon as a platform

comment.body: @ekohl and @bastelfreak based on the comments, does it seem good for now?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -302,7 +302,7 @@ def ssh_service_restart
   #   (from {#ssh_service_restart}).
   def ssh_permit_user_environment
     case self['platform']
-    when /debian|ubuntu|cumulus|huaweios|archlinux|el-|centos|fedora|redhat|oracle|scientific|eos|opensuse|sles|solaris/
+    when /amazon|debian|ubuntu|cumulus|huaweios|archlinux|el-|centos|fedora|redhat|oracle|scientific|eos|opensuse|sles|solaris/

issue.title: Consider setting defaults to systemctl/systemd commands
issue.body: The bulk of OSs we support are systemd based, so per the comment https://github.com/voxpupuli/beaker/pull/1824#discussion_r1336394432, as the most common type of OS, we should probably default to those types of commands in order to make it easier to add new distros in the future. This would eliminate maintaining long inclusions like https://github.com/voxpupuli/beaker/blob/cc5fd870d95dc70ffe27d90516951be4910dc8f3/lib/beaker/host/unix/exec.rb#L305

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -280,7 +280,7 @@ def ssh_service_restart
     case self['platform']
     when /debian|ubuntu|cumulus|huaweios/
       exec(Beaker::Command.new("service ssh restart"))
-    when /(el|centos|redhat|oracle|scientific)-[7-9]|eos-7|fedora-(1[4-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-9])|archlinux-/
+    when /amazon-\d{4,}|(el|centos|redhat|oracle|scientific)-[7-9]|eos-7|fedora-(1[4-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-9])|archlinux-/
comment.body: Ya that's true, I was trying to maintain AL1 compat, but no need for that.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -280,7 +280,7 @@ def ssh_service_restart
     case self['platform']
     when /debian|ubuntu|cumulus|huaweios/
       exec(Beaker::Command.new("service ssh restart"))
-    when /(el|centos|redhat|oracle|scientific)-[7-9]|eos-7|fedora-(1[4-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-9])|archlinux-/
+    when /amazon-\d{4,}|(el|centos|redhat|oracle|scientific)-[7-9]|eos-7|fedora-(1[4-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-9])|archlinux-/
comment.body:
Isn't Amazon Linux 2 also systemd based? And Amazon Linux 1 is EOL and not caught by anything else, so I'd keep it simple:
```suggestion
    when /amazon|(el|centos|redhat|oracle|scientific)-[7-9]|eos-7|fedora-(1[4-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-9])|archlinux-/
```

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -302,7 +302,7 @@ def ssh_service_restart
   #   (from {#ssh_service_restart}).
   def ssh_permit_user_environment
     case self['platform']
-    when /debian|ubuntu|cumulus|huaweios|archlinux|el-|centos|fedora|redhat|oracle|scientific|eos|opensuse|sles|solaris/
+    when /amazon|debian|ubuntu|cumulus|huaweios|archlinux|el-|centos|fedora|redhat|oracle|scientific|eos|opensuse|sles|solaris/
comment.body: That does make sense, but not sure how many changes to defaults I wanted to do outside of the addition itself. So your saying for the functions that involved a change, they should default to the correct systemd/systemctl command instead of raising an error?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -302,7 +302,7 @@ def ssh_service_restart
   #   (from {#ssh_service_restart}).
   def ssh_permit_user_environment
     case self['platform']
-    when /debian|ubuntu|cumulus|huaweios|archlinux|el-|centos|fedora|redhat|oracle|scientific|eos|opensuse|sles|solaris/
+    when /amazon|debian|ubuntu|cumulus|huaweios|archlinux|el-|centos|fedora|redhat|oracle|scientific|eos|opensuse|sles|solaris/
comment.body: I am not sure if we want strict checking here or just make this the default. all the linux distributions use systemctl and BSD/windows are aome special setups. that would make adding more linux OS support easier.
